message.content:
{"id": "47910", 
"title": "Bug 47910 - ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF", 
 "description": "When using the ajc command with the options sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension. However, this file is not a valid jar file because it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file. The ajc documentation suggests that the outjar parameter should put the output classes in a zip file, but it doesn't make sense for a parameter called outjar to create a zip file.",
 "OB": "When calling ajc with the options sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, the output file created with a .jar extension does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.",
 "EB": "The output file created by ajc with the sourceroots and outjar options should be a valid jar file and include a MANIFEST.MF file.",
 "SR": "To reproduce this issue, call ajc with the sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar options and observe that the output file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '47910', 'title': 'Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF', 'description': 'with a METAINF/MANIFEST.MFfile inside. ', 'OB': "Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar and an output file is createdwith a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is noMANIFEST.MF file. I see that the text for ajc says:outjar <fileput output classes in zip file <filewhich might imply that it is supposed to be a zip file, but a parameter called outjar which creates a zip file doesn't really make sense. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': 'I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar and an output file is createdwith a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is noMANIFEST.MF file. '}
